document_title: Diphtheria: unpredictable complications and effective prevention
subsection_content:
The disease can be effectively prevented by vaccination. In Vietnam, there is currently no single vaccine to prevent diphtheria, only combination vaccines that contain diphtheria antigens.
In the National Immunization Program, there are vaccines such as:
5-in-1 vaccine to prevent diphtheria - pertussis - tetanus - Hib - hepatitis B (DPT-HGB-Hib): injected when children are 2, 3, 4 months old; Diphtheria - pertussis - tetanus vaccine: given when children are 16-18 months old; Diphtheria - tetanus vaccine for high-risk adult groups is only used in campaigns when there is an epidemic and is not universally administered.
Service vaccines include vaccines such as:
6-in-1 vaccine Hexaxim (France) or Infanrix Hexa (Belgium) prevents 6 diseases Diphtheria - Pertussis - Tetanus - Polio - Hib - Hepatitis B: injected when children are 2, 3, 4 months old and when children are 16 – 18 months old.; Pentaxim (France) 5-in-1 vaccine prevents 5 diseases Diphtheria - Pertussis - Tetanus - Hib - Polio: injected when children are 2, 3, 4 months old and when children are 16 - 18 months old.; Tetraxim 4-in-1 vaccine (France) prevents Diphtheria - Pertussis - Tetanus - Polio: for people from 2 months to 13 years old, especially booster vaccination when children are 4-6 years old for children Do not inject 5 in 1 or 6 in 1.; Adacel (France), Boostrix (Belgium) vaccines prevent 3 diseases: Diphtheria - Tetanus - Whooping cough: for children over 4 years old and adults, it is often recommended to get a booster shot of this vaccine every 10 years.
The vaccination schedule for service vaccines includes:
Type of Vaccine 6in1 Vaccine 5in1 Vaccine 4in1 Vaccine 3in1 Vaccine Vaccine Name Hexaxim Infanrix Hexa Pentaxim Tetraxim Adacel Boostrix Origin France Belgium France France Belgium Prevention 6-in-1 combination vaccine prevents 6 diseases: Diphtheria, Cough Chickenpox, Tetanus, Polio, Hepatitis B, Hib 5-in-1 combination vaccine prevents 5 diseases: Diphtheria, Pertussis, Tetanus, Polio, Hib 4-in-1 combination vaccine prevents 4 diseases: Diphtheria , Pertussis, Tetanus, Polio 3-in-1 vaccine prevents 3 diseases: Diphtheria, Tetanus, Pertussis  3-in-1 combination vaccine prevents 3 diseases: Diphtheria, Tetanus, Pertussis Children from 2 – 24 months old Children from 2 – 24 months old Children from 2 months old to 13 years old Children from 4 years old to adults 64 years old. Children from 4 years old to adults Vaccination schedule 4-shot vaccination schedule: Shots 1,2,3: When the child is 2, 3, 4 months old or 2, 4, 6 months old. Nose 4: When the child is 16 – 18 months old. 4-shot vaccination schedule: Shots 1,2,3: When the child is 2, 3, 4 months old or 2, 4, 6 months old. Nose 4: When the child is 16 – 18 months old. 5-shot vaccination schedule: Shots 1, 2, 3: When the child is 2, 3, 4 months old or 2, 4, 6 months old. Nose 4: When the child is 16 - 18 months old. Booster vaccination: Children 4-6 years old. Children from 4 years of age and older to adults and the elderly under 64 years of age: 1 injection. Repeat vaccination every 5 - 10 years. Children from 4 years old to adults and the elderly: 1 injection. Repeat vaccination every 10 years.
This is a disease with a rapid spread rate, dangerous complications and especially a high mortality rate. Therefore, whether children or adults, they need to be fully vaccinated and go to the hospital for treatment as soon as symptoms appear to avoid unfortunate consequences later.
The vaccination program of Tam Anh General Hospital, Hanoi also has available combination vaccines including diphtheria antigen components to serve the vaccination needs of customers.
In addition to the above advantages, Tam Anh General Hospital, Hanoi also pays special attention to customer experience when coming for medical examination and treatment, with a dedicated customer care team and well-furnished clinic. Impressed with the high-class play area, creating a comfortable and happy mentality for children coming for examination, vaccination and treatment.
